result.execSummary:
The defendant Joseph Fabian Chavez Jr. was found guilty of the following charge(s) in this case.

  • Battery, a class A misdemeanor, Wisconsin Statutes 940.19(1).
  • Bail Jumping-Misdemeanor, a class A misdemeanor, Wisconsin Statutes 946.49(1)(a).

Charge(s) in this case were read in to this or other case(s). A "read in" charge is a charge that is dismissed as part of a plea agreement, however:

  • The defendant agrees to have the court consider the charge(s) when sentencing for another crime, under Wis. Stats. 973.20(1g)(b); and
  • The defendant cannot be prosecuted for these charge(s) in the future.

Notice to employers: It may be a violation of state law to discriminate against a job applicant because of an arrest or conviction record. Generally speaking, an employer may refuse to hire an applicant on the basis of a conviction only if the circumstances of the conviction substantially relate to the particular job. For more information, see Wisconsin Statute 111.335 and the Department of Workforce Development's publication, Arrest and Conviction Records under the Law.

result.caption: State of Wisconsin vs. Joseph Fabian Chavez Jr.

records.addlTxt:
Defendant Joseph Fabian Chavez Jr. in court, in custody.  Attorney Joel H. Rosenthal in court for Joseph Fabian Chavez Jr.  Prosecuting attorney Nate Kristian McClure in court for the State of Wisconsin. 
Case in court for Plea and Sentencing Hearing.  State advised the Court they have complied with the Victims' Rights Law. 
Parties have reached a resolution. State placed negotiations on the record. Defense counsel and defendant confirms. 
Court is in receipt of the; Plea Questionnaire, Addendum and WIS JI- Criminal/ Elements of the Offense.


AS TO COUNTS 1 AND 2:
PLEA HEARING HELD:  Defendant changes his plea to GUILTY.  Defendant examined as to his plea, advised of his Constitutional rights and the maximum penalty.  
Defendant advised that if he is not a United States Citizen, deportation is possible. Court found that defendant knowingly, voluntarily and intelligently waived his rights. 
Parties stipulate to the complaint as a factual basis to sustain defendant's plea. State consents to the Jury Waiver. Court found defendant guilty and ordered a Judgment of Conviction be entered on the record. 
Court ordered a DNA sample and advised defendant of applicable surcharge. 

AS TO COUNTS 3,4, and 5 - Pursuant to negotiations and on the Motion of the State, Court Ordered Charge DISMISSED BUT READ IN for the purpose of sentencing.




AS TO COUNTS 1 AND 2, SENTENCING HEARING HELD: Statements by the State, Defense counsel and Defendant.

AS TO COUNT 1: COURT ORDERED Defendant to serve 6 MONTHS in the House of Correction with credit for 53 DAYS time served.  
Court IMPOSED AND STAYED sentence and placed defendant on PROBATION for 24 MONTHS, to run concurrent with COUNT 2.
Court orders that probation can be terminated early if the probation agent deems it appropriate.

AS TO COUNT 2: COURT ORDERED Defendant to serve 6 MONTHS in the House of Correction with credit for 53 DAYS time served.  
Court IMPOSED AND STAYED sentence and placed defendant on PROBATION for 24 MONTHS, to run concurrent with COUNT 1.
Court orders that probation can be terminated early if the probation agent deems it appropriate.
    
* 60 DAYS of condition time, IMPOSED AND STAYED, to be used at the discretion of the agent.
* Defendant to provide DNA specimen pay DNA surcharge.
* Court waives all costs due to inability to pay. 
* AODA Assessment and comply with any recommended treatment determined by the agent. Order for Intox driver assessment and safety plan forwarded to the Judge. 
* Mental health assessment and comply with any recommended treatment determined by the agent. 
* No possession of dangerous weapons or firearms. 
* No violent contact with JFC.
* Appellate Rights given.

Defendant Joseph Fabian Chavez Jr. in court, in custody.  Attorney Joel H. Rosenthal in court for Joseph Fabian Chavez Jr.  Prosecuting attorney Thomas Hasle in court for the State of Wisconsin. 
Case in court for plea/sentencing hearing.
State placed offer on the record.
For reasons set forth in the record, Court ordered plea/sentencing hearing adjourned.
Parties notified this case will be heard in front of Reserve Judge Kremers, Branch 13.
Notice of Right to Seek Postconviction Relief, filed.

Defendant Joseph Fabian Chavez Jr. not in court.  Attorney Joel H. Rosenthal in court for Joseph Fabian Chavez Jr.  Prosecuting attorney Thomas Hasle in court for the State of Wisconsin. 
CASE HEARD OFF THE RECORD.
Due to court congestion, Court ordered case adjourned.
Court ordered case adjourned for projected guilty plea and sentencing in Branch 13.
Plea/sentencing hearing scheduled for September 16, 2022 at 02:00 pm.
Court ordered defendant TURNED OVER TO Justice Point for SUPERVISION Level 5. No possession of dangerous weapons or firearms.

Defendant Joseph Fabian Chavez Jr. appeared by video.  Attorney Joel H. Rosenthal appeared by phone for Joseph Fabian Chavez Jr. Attorney Michael J. Odden appeared by video for the State of Wisconsin.  Defendant is advised this case is assigned to Reserve Judge, Branch 13.  Court reviewed the complaint and found probable cause.  Defendant advised of right to counsel and complaint given to defendant's attorney.  Defendant pled not guilty.  DEFENDANT IS INDIGENT AND QUALIFIES FOR PUBLIC DEFENDER REPRESENTATION.  Case is adjourned to Branch 13.
Status conference scheduled for September 15, 2022 at 11:00 am.

Defendant Joseph Fabian Chavez Jr. in court, in custody.  Attorney Joel H. Rosenthal in court for Joseph Fabian Chavez Jr.  Prosecuting attorney Nate Kristian McClure in court for the State of Wisconsin. Doctor's report received and filed.  Parties reviewed Dr. Collins report and do not contest findings. State, defense and defendant waive right to hearing. Court found defendant competent to proceed and reinstated proceedings.  

Case is adjourned for initial appearance in intake court.
Forensic evaluation ordered.  INITIAL APPEARANCE NOT HELD.  Trial court to address INITIAL APPEARANCE.

Defendant Joseph Fabian Chavez in court with attorney Brett Lee Copeland.  Defendant Joseph Fabian Chavez in custody.  Michael J. Odden appeared for the State of Wisconsin.  Joseph Fabian Chavez appeared by video means with Attorney.  Court is advised by the defense there is reason to believe the defendant is not competent to proceed.  Pursuant to Sec. 971.14 (2) Wisconsin Statutes, Court found probable cause and ordered defendant examined by the Forensic Unit.  Order for Examination, signed and filed.   Defendant is advised this case is assigned to Reserve Judge, Branch 13.  Court ordered defendant REMANDED into custody of Milwaukee County Sheriff's Department.  Doctor's Report Return scheduled for August 25, 2022 at 08:30 am.
Defendant in Custody, Court appearance today in Intake Court, Room 137A.
